snippet: The dispute pits nurse anesthetists, who specialize in administering anesthesia and maintain that they are well equipped to treat patients on their own, against anesthesiologists.
abstract: Long-running dispute over whether nurses should be allowed to administer anesthesia without doctor supervision is being played out in Colorado appeals court; nurse anesthetists maintain that they are well equipped to treat patients on their own, but anesthesiologists, who are doctors,say nurses lack the necessary training; 17 states allow nurses to deliver anesthesia without supervision.
lead_paragraph: The dispute pits nurse anesthetists, who specialize in administering anesthesia and maintain that they are well equipped to treat patients on their own, against anesthesiologists.

headline.main: Debate Over Who Should Be Allowed to Administer Anesthesia Moves to Courts
headline.print_headline: Debate Over Who Should Be Allowed to Administer Anesthesia Moves to Courts
